introductions.introduction: Welcome to Italian reflexive verbs! These are essential patterns where the action reflects back to the subject. In Italian, reflexive pronouns (mi, ti, si) are very common and often used differently than in English. Master these patterns and you'll sound much more natural!
learning_tips: Focus on pronunciation of each phrase
Notice how these patterns appear in context
Try creating your own sentences using these structures

introductions.introduction: Modal verbs in Italian (dovere, potere, volere) are your gateway to expressing ability, necessity, and desire. These verbs combine with infinitives to create powerful communication tools. Learn these patterns and you'll be able to express what you can, must, and want to do!
learning_tips: Focus on pronunciation of each phrase
Notice how these patterns appear in context
Try creating your own sentences using these structures

introductions.introduction: These high-frequency Italian phrases are the building blocks of natural conversation. Expressions like "mi piace" (I like) and "ho bisogno di" (I need) are used constantly by native speakers. Master these and you'll immediately sound more fluent!
learning_tips: Focus on pronunciation of each phrase
Notice how these patterns appear in context
Try creating your own sentences using these structures
